word.description:
The glyph origins of {水} resemble a flowing stream. {氵} is the left [radical](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Radical_(Chinese_characters)) form of this character, so if you see a character with that on the left, chances are it has something to do with water or liquid, e.g. {酒} *liquor*, {油} *oil* (the edible kind) or *sauce*, {海} *ocean*, and {清} *soup*.

**Ordering**

{杯} is *cup* (or mug or glass) and is the [measure word](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Measure_word) for water (and other drinks), and {一} is *one*, so to order a glass of water, ask for 一杯水 (yāt būi séui in Cantonese, yī bēi shuǐ in Mandarin), *one cup of water*.

{杯} is *cup* (or mug or glass) and is the [measure word](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Measure_word) for water (and other drinks), and {一} is *one*, so to order a glass of ice water, ask for 一杯冰水 (yāt būi bīng séui in Cantonese, yī bēi bīng shuǐ in Mandarin), *one cup of ice water*.

{凍} is *cold*, and {水} is *water*, so {凍水} is *cold water*.

{杯} is *cup* (or mug or glass) and is the [measure word](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Measure_word) for water (and other drinks), and {一} is *one*, so to order a glass of cold water, ask for 一杯凍水 (yāt būi dong séui in Cantonese, yī bēi dòng shuǐ in Mandarin), *one cup of cold water*.

{熱} is *hot*, and {水} is *water*, so {熱水} is *hot water*.

{杯} is *cup* (or mug or glass) and is the [measure word](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Measure_word) for water (and other drinks), and {一} is *one*, so to order a glass of cold water, ask for 一杯熱水 (yāt būi yiht séui in Cantonese, yī bēi dòng shuǐ in Mandarin), *one cup of cold water*.

description: Chinese restaurants often serve not just cold water but also hot water. Drinking hot water is considered healthy for a combination of traditional medicine and water sanitation reasons.
